ray.rage.math

Class Transform

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.rage.math.Transform

  • public class Transform
extends java.lang.Object
    A transform represents a translation, rotation, and scale as a single object.
    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Transform createDefault()
      Creates a new transform with its position at the origin, no rotation, and no scaling.
      static Transform createFrom(Transform xform)
      Creates a new transform based on the given transform.
      static Transform createFrom(Vector3 position)
      Creates a new transform with the given position, no rotation, and no scaling.
      static Transform createFrom(Vector3 position, Matrix3 rotation)
      Creates a new transform with the given position and rotation, but no scaling.
      static Transform createFrom(Vector3 position, Matrix3 rotation, Vector3 scale)
      Creates a new transform with the given position, rotation, and scaling.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj) 
      int hashCode() 
      Vector3 position()
      Gets the position vector of this transform.
      Matrix3 rotation()
      Gets the rotation matrix of this transform.
      Vector3 scale()
      Gets the scaling vector of this transform.
      Transform setPosition(float x, float y, float z)
      Sets the position of this transform using primitive types.
      Transform setPosition(Vector3 position)
      Sets the position vector of this transform.
      Transform setRotation(Matrix3 rotation)
      Sets the rotation matrix of this transform.
      Transform setScale(float x, float y, float z)
      Sets the scaling of this transform using primitive types.
      Transform setScale(Vector3 scale)
      Sets the scaling vector of this transform.
      Matrix4 toMatrixTRS()
      Converts this transform to a matrix that combines Translation, Rotation, and Scaling, in that order.
